# SOLUTION
# This is just a simple application of modulo operation.
# The minimum number of moves will be the difference between
# a and the remainder when a is divided by b.
# Runtime: O(1)

t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    a, b = map(int, input().split())
    print(a % b)


# SOLUTION
# This is just a simple application of modulo operation.
# The minimum number of moves will be the difference between
# a and the remainder when a is divided by b.
# Runtime: O(1)

def main():
    t = int(input())
    for _ in range(t):
        a, b = map(int, input().split())
        print(a % b)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()


# SOLUTION
# This is just a simple application of modulo operation.
# The minimum number of moves will be the difference between
# a and the remainder when a is divided by b.
# Runtime: O(1)

t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    a, b = map(int, input().split())
    print(a % b)
#!/usr/bin/env python3

import sys

def main():
    t = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    for _ in range(t):
        a, b = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())
        print(b - a % b)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

def main():
    t = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    for _ in range(t):
        a, b = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())
        print(b - a % b) 

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
#!/usr/bin/env python3

import sys

def main():
    t = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    for _ in range(t):
        a, b = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())
        print(b - a % b if a % b != 0 else 0)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
